entry.title: Enable colors in Mercurial (HG)
entry.summary: How to enable colors in Mercurial console output
entry.content:
What is it

ColorExtension - is a Mercurial extetsion that allows you to highlight some information in console output. The extension ships with Mercurial so there is no need to install it separately.

Setup

To enable ColorExtension, open your hgrc file and add "color=" to "extensions" section. Like that:

[extensions]
color =

To override current colors, add "colors" section with color definitions to your hgrc. For example:

[color]
status.modified = blue bold underline red_background
status.added = green bold
status.removed = red bold blue_background
status.deleted = cyan bold underline
status.unknown = magenta bold underline
status.ignored = black bold

You can override colors for other states and actions in the same way.

If you want to switch some colors off, place "none" in the config:

status.clean = none
status.copied = none
